intro: Alyxia tetanifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive, tubular corolla. Alyxia tetanifolia is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
